TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit TransitionPropagation extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Extend TransitionPropagation to customize start delays for Animators created in .

remarks.para: Extend TransitionPropagation to customize start delays for Animators created in . A Transition such as defaults to using and Views closer to the epicenter will move out of the scene later and into the scene sooner than Views farther from the epicenter, giving the appearance of inertia. With no TransitionPropagation, all Views will react simultaneously to the start of the transition.

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CaptureValues(class Android.Transitions.TransitionValues transitionValues) cil managed

Docs.param: The holder for any values that the Transition wishes to store. Values are stored in the values field of this TransitionValues object and are keyed from a String value. For example, to store a view's rotation value, a transition might call transitionValues.values.put("appname:transitionname:rotation", view.getRotation()). The target view will already be stored in the transitionValues structure when this method is called.
Docs.summary: Captures the values in the start or end scene for the properties that this transition propagation monitors.

remarks.para: Captures the values in the start or end scene for the properties that this transition propagation monitors. These values are then passed as the startValues or endValues structure in a later call to . The main concern for an implementation is what the properties are that the transition cares about and what the values are for all of those properties. The start and end values will be compared later during the . method to determine the start delay.
Subclasses must implement this method. The method should only be called by the transition system; it is not intended to be called from external classes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string[] GetPropagationProperties() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the set of property names stored in the object passed into that this transition propagation cares about for the purposes of preventing duplicate capturing of property values.

remarks.para: Returns the set of property names stored in the object passed into that this transition propagation cares about for the purposes of preventing duplicate capturing of property values.
A TransitionPropagation must override this method to prevent duplicate capturing of values and must contain at least one

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract long GetStartDelay (Android.Views.ViewGroup sceneRoot, Android.Transitions.Transition transition, Android.Transitions.TransitionValues startValues, Android.Transitions.TransitionValues endValues);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance int64 GetStartDelay(class Android.Views.ViewGroup sceneRoot, class Android.Transitions.Transition transition, class Android.Transitions.TransitionValues startValues, class Android.Transitions.TransitionValues endValues) cil managed

Docs.param: The root of the View hierarchy running the transition.
The transition that created the Animator
The values for a specific target in the start scene.
The values for the target in the end scene.
Docs.summary: Called by Transition to alter the Animator start delay.

remarks.para: Called by Transition to alter the Animator start delay. All start delays will be adjusted such that the minimum becomes zero.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
